name: Chad
introduction: Chad part of France's African holdings until 1960 endured three decades of civil warfare as well as invasions by Libya before peace was restored in 1990. The government eventually drafted a democratic constitution and held flawed presidential elections in 1996 and 2001. In 1998 a rebellion broke out in northern Chad which has sporadically flared up despite several peace agreements between the government and insurgents. In June 2005 President Idriss DEBY held a referendum successfully removing constitutional term limits and won another controversial election in 2006. Sporadic rebel campaigns continued throughout 2006 and 2007. The capital experienced a significant insurrection in early 2008 but has had no significant rebel threats since then in part due to Chad's 2010 rapprochement with Sudan which previously used Chadian rebels as proxies. In late 2015 the government imposed a state of emergency in the Lake Chad region following multiple attacks by the terrorist group Boko Haram throughout the year; Boko Haram also launched several bombings in N'Djamena in mid-2015. DEBY in 2011 was reelected to his fourth term in an election that international observers described as proceeding without incident. In January 2014 Chad began a two-year rotation on the UN Security Council.
overview: Chad officially the Republic of Chad is a landlocked country in Central Africa. It is bordered by Libya to the north Sudan to the east the Central African Republic to the south Cameroon and Nigeria to the southwest and Niger to the west.

languages.name: Algerian Saharan Arabic
languages.location: Algeria, Morocco, Tunisia and Western Sahara
languages.area: Morocco border along Atlas Mountains, northeast to Medea (south of Algiers), southeast to Righ Wadi, south as far as Plateau du Tademait; some in Tamanrasset town. Also in Egypt, Niger, United States.

languages.name: Amdang
languages.area: Wadi Fira region, Biltine Departement, Biltine Sous-Préfecture, Mimi Goz and Mimi Hadjer cantons north of Biltine; Batha region; Ouaddaï region.

languages.name: Sudanese Arabic
languages.area: Primarily north. Also in Egypt, Eritrea, Ethiopia, Libya, Saudi Arabia.

languages.name: Arabic
languages.area: Middle East, North Africa. Also in Algeria, Bahrain, Chad, Comoros, Djibouti, Egypt, Eritrea, Iraq, Israel, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Libya, Morocco, Oman, Palestinian West Bank and Gaza, Qatar, Somalia, Sudan, Syria, Tanzania, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, Yemen.

languages.name: Babalia Creole Arabic
languages.area: West, Chari Baguirmi Prefecture, N’Djamena Subprefecture. North of Djermaya and between Karal and Tourba. Possibly in Bokoro Subprefecture, Ngoura area. 23 villages.

languages.name: Buduma
languages.area: Lac region, Mamdi Department, Bol Subprefecture, islands and Lake Chad north shore. Also in Cameroon, Nigeria.

languages.name: Morom
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Bitkine Subprefecture and Dababa Department, Bokoro and Gama subprefectures, west of Bolong village to Chari Baguirmi Prefecture border.

languages.name: Besme
languages.area: Southwest, Tandjilé Prefecture, Kélo and Laï subprefectures, in Besmé, Bodor, and 3 other villages along Logone River northwest of Laï.

languages.name: Bidiyo
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Mongo Subprefecture, south of Mongo and west of Abou Telfane.

languages.name: Bedjond
languages.area: Mandoul region, Mandoul Occidental Department, Bediondo area, west of the Day [dai].

languages.name: Bagirmi
languages.area: West, Chari Baguirmi Prefecture. 2 groups: Massénya Subprefecture, Massénya area; Bousso Subprefecture, Bousso area. Gol are at Massénya; Kibar east of Massénya; Bangri west of Massénya and along Chari River between Guélendeng and N’Djaména; Dam along Chari River from Bousso to Guélenden. Also in Nigeria.

languages.name: Buso
languages.area: Chari-Baguirmi region, Loug-Chari Department, Bousso Subprefecture, Maffaling and Bousso.

languages.name: Birgit
languages.area: Salamat region, Abou Déïa and Barh-Azoum Departments; Ouaddaï region, Djourf-al-Ahmar Department; centered in Abgué.

languages.name: Bua
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Barh Kôh Department, Sarh Subprefecture, Korbol area and northeast; Guéra region, Barh Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture.

languages.name: Barein
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, west (Jalkia), south, southwest (Komi), and east (Sakaya) of Melfi.

languages.name: Boor
languages.area: Chari-Baguirmi region, Loug-Chari Department, Bousso Subprefecture; Moyen-Chari region, Barh Kôh Department Sarh Subprefecture, Dumraw area (Bwara) village on Chari River north bank, just east of Miltu.

languages.name: Bolgo
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, east of the Barain, southeast of Melfi.

languages.name: Berakou
languages.area: West, Chari Baguirmi Prefecture; N’Djamena Subprefecture, north of Djermaya and between Karal and Tourba; Bokoro Subprefecture, Ngoura area. 23 villages.

languages.name: Chadian Sign Language
languages.area: Schools and an association for the deaf in N’Djamena, Sarh, and Moundou.

languages.name: Kajakse
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Djourf-Al-Ahmar Department,. South and southeast of Am Dam. Some refugees in Sudan near the border.

languages.name: Mandarin Chinese
languages.area: Widespread north of Changjiang River, a belt south of the Changjiang from Qiujiang (Jiangxi) to Zhenjiang (Jiangsu), Hubei, except southeast corner, Sichuan, Yunnan, Guizhou, northwest part of Guangxi, and northwest corner of Hunan. Also in Brunei, Cambodia, Canada, Indonesia (Java and Bali), Laos, Libya, Malaysia (Peninsular), Mauritius, Mongolia, Mozambique, Philippines, Russian Federation (Asia), Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, United Kingdom, United States, Viet Nam, Zambia.

languages.name: Dangaléat
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Mongo and Bitkine subprefectures, west of Mongo. Western dialect around Korbo; Central around Barlo, Koubo Adougoul; East around Korlongo.

languages.name: Day
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Barh Kôh Department (Sarh); Mandoul region, Barh Sara Department (Moïssala), southwest of Sarh.

languages.name: Dar Sila Daju
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Sila Department; Goz-Beïda area and east to Sudan border; Salamat region, Barh Azoum Department, camps of internally displaced people. Also in Sudan.

languages.name: Dagba
languages.area: Batangafo, Kabo, and Bossangoa subprefectures. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Dar Daju Daju
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Mongo Subprefecture, Mongo and Eref area.

languages.name: Disa
languages.area: Guéra region, Barh Signaka Department, Chinguil Subprefecture.

languages.name: Dazaga

languages.name: Fongoro
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Sila Department, canton Fongoro; Dar Fongoro region along Sudan border south of Mongororo and the Sinyar, rather inaccessible.

languages.name: Fania
languages.area: Guéra region, Barh Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, west of Lake Iro; north of Sarh, Mouraye area, Sengué, Malakonjo, Rim, Sisi, Karo villages.

languages.name: French
languages.area: Also in Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Belgium, Benin, Burkina Faso, Burundi, Cambodia, Cameroon, Canada, Central African Republic, Chad, Comoros, Congo, Côte d’Ivoire, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Djibouti, Equatorial Guinea, French Guiana, French Polynesia, Gabon, Guadeloupe, Guinea, Haiti, India, Israel, Italy, Lebanon, Libya, Luxembourg, Madagascar, Mali, Martinique, Mauritania, Mauritius, Mayotte, Monaco, Morocco, Mozambique, New Caledonia, Niger, Philippines, Puerto Rico, Réunion, Rwanda, Saint Pierre and Miquelon, Saudi Arabia, Senegal, Seychelles, South Africa, Switzerland, Togo, Tunisia, United Arab Emirates, United Kingdom, United States, U.S. Virgin Islands, Vanuatu, Wallis and Futuna.

languages.name: Adamawa Fulfulde
languages.area: Widespead in Far North, North and Adamawa provinces. Also in Chad, Nigeria, Sudan, United States.

languages.name: Bagirmi Fulfulde
languages.area: Chari-Baguirmi region, Baguirmi Department, Massénya Subprefecture; Hadjer Lamis region, Dababa Department, Bokoro Subprefecture, between Bokoro and Massénya. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Nigerian Fulfulde

languages.name: Fur
languages.area: North, Darfur; east. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Gabri

languages.name: Ga'dang

languages.name: Gadang

languages.name: Laal

languages.name: Gidar
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Louti Division, Guider and Figuil subdivisions; Far North Province, a small section of Diamare Division. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Bon Gula
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, north of Lake Iro, northeast of Zan. Bon and Ibir villages.

languages.name: Gula Iro
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Lac Iro Department; Salamat region, Barh-Azoum Department; Lake Iro, Boum Kabir area, northeast of Sarh. Pongaal dialect in Boum Kabir, Boum Saher, Madjok, Teonen, and Karou; Tiaala in Masidjanga (Cheroba), Bouni, and Kore; Patool in Badi and Foundouk; Korintal in Cheou (Tieou); west Salamat region, Tiitaal.

languages.name: Gula (Chad)
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Lac Iro Department, Alako and Boum-Kebir subprefectures, southwest of Lake Iro.

languages.name: Goundo
languages.area: Tanjilé Prefecture, Laï and Kélo subprefectures, Goundo-Bengli, Goundo-Nangom, and Goundo-Yila villages.

languages.name: Gor
languages.area: Logone Oriental region, La Pendé Department, Bodo center area.

languages.name: Gulay
languages.area: Moyen-Chari (6 cantons), Logone Oriental (1 canton), and Tandjilé (1 canton) regions, between Koumra, Laï, and Doba.

languages.name: Hausa
languages.area: Sokoto, Kaduna, Katsina, Kano, Bauchi, Jigawa, Zamfara, Kebbi, and Gombe states. Spoken as L2 in north. Also in Benin, Burkina Faso, Cameroon, Central African Republic, Chad, Congo, Eritrea, Germany, Ghana, Niger, Sudan, Togo.

languages.name: Herdé
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah (Pala) and Lac Léré Departments (Léré), Pala and Lamé area; near the Pevé, west of the Ngueté.

languages.name: Horo
languages.area: Béhor north of Sarh on the Chari River.

languages.name: Jonkor Bourmataguil
languages.area: Salamat region, Abou Deïa Department, west of Abou Deïa. Originally centered in Bourmataguil village, now centered in Ader-Ader.

languages.name: Jaya
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Bitkine Subprefecture, 50 kms. north-northwest of Bitkine.

languages.name: Kanembu
languages.area: Kanem, Lac regions; and Hadjer-Lamis region, Dagana Department, Massakory Subprefecture.

languages.name: Kera
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mont d’Illi Department, south of Fianga, near Lake Tikem. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Kim
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mayo Boneye Department, villages Eré, Djouman, Kolobo and Kim southeast of Bongor.

languages.name: Kibet
languages.area: Salamat region, Barh-Azoum Department and Ouaddaï region, Sila Department. Northeast of Am Timan and southwest of Goz Beïda.

languages.name: Kendeje

languages.name: Central Kanuri

languages.name: Lagwan
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, north of Waza National Park in Logone-Birni Subdivision, Logone River bank across to Nigeria border. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Koke
languages.area: Guéra region, Barh Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, southeast of Melfi; Daguéla, Sengué, and Djourab village areas.

languages.name: Kimré
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjile Est Department, east of Laï.

languages.name: Mser
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, Kousseri Subdivision. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Kaba
languages.area: Paoua and Marounda subprefectures. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Karanga
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Djourf-Al-Ahmar and Ouara departments. Around Am Dam and between Am Dam and Abéché, south of the Maba. Bakha are southwest of Am Dam, Karanga and Koniéré are northeast of Am Dam, Kashmere are south of Abéché and north of the Karanga.

languages.name: Kabalai
languages.area: Southwest Chad, Tandjile Prefecture, Lai Subprefecture; Lai and to the south on the eastern bank of Logone River.

languages.name: Kwang
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Est Department. North of Laï, east of Bongor, southwest of Bousso. The Mobou are in Mobou, south of Bousso; Aloa are in Mogo.

languages.name: Sara Kaba Deme
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Barh Kôh and Lac Iro Departments, between Sarh and Kyabé. Along Chari River, Bobé, Hélibongo, Banda, Moussafoyo, Kemata villages. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Sara Kaba Náà
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Lac Iro Department, centered in Kyabé. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Kulfa
languages.area: Southeast, Moyen Chari Prefecture, Kyabé Subprefecture, southwest of Lake Iro. Centered in Alako and Kirimikoro.

languages.name: Kenga
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Bitkine Subprefecture, around Bitkine, 52 villages, including Bolongo, Bokiyo.

languages.name: Karang
languages.area: North Province, Mayo-Rey Division, Madingring District [homeland], south border of Bouba Ndjida National Park, south from Madingring, southeast to Lawzigoy (toward Touboro). 25 villages. [displaced: Garoua, Ngong, Ngaoundéré, Touboro (and surrounding villages), Tcholliré]. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Lele (Chad)
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Ouest Department, south of Kélo.

languages.name: Pévé
languages.area: Southwest near Cameroon border, Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Lamé home of Chef de Canton, and administrative center. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Masana
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mayo-Boneye Department, Bongor Subprefecture, along Logone River. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Mambai
languages.area: North Province, Benoue Division, extreme north Bibemi Subdivision, along Mayo-Kebi River near Chad border. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mawa (Chad)
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Bitkine Subprefecture, about 30 km south of Bitkine, centered around the village of Mahoua. Southeast of the Mukulu.

languages.name: Mbum
languages.area: West Mbum, isolated in Adamawa Province, Vina and Djerem divisions, south and southwest of Ngaoundere; North Province, Faro Division, Ngaoundere area to border of Faro Reserve; East Province, Lom-and-Djerem Division, Belabo Subdivision, Gbete. Also in Central African Republic, United States.

languages.name: Maba (Chad)
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Ouara and Djourf-al-Ahmar departments and Wadi Fira region, Biltine Department, Biltine Subprefecture; most of Ouara Department and villages south of Biltine.

languages.name: Massalat
languages.area: Batha region, Batha Est Department, Oum Hadjer Subprefecture, and Ouaddaï region, Djourf-Al-Ahmar Department, Am Dam Subprefecture.

languages.name: Masmaje
languages.area: Batha region, Batha Est Department, Oum Hadjer Subprefecture, southwest of Oum Hadjer, north of the Mubi.

languages.name: Mararit
languages.area: Wadi Fira region, Biltine Department, Am Zoer Subprefecture (Abou Charib), and Ouaddaï region, Assoungha Department, Mabrone Subprefecture (Mararit).

languages.name: Mango
languages.area: Logone Oriental region, La Pendé Departmnt, Bodo Subprefecture.

languages.name: Muskum
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mayo-Boneye Department, Bongor Subprefecture or Mayo Lemie Department. Along Logone River, west of Guélengdeng, village of Muskum (Mouskoun), 10 kms. north of Katoa.

languages.name: Miltu
languages.area: Chari-Baguirmi region, Loug-Chari Department, Bousso Subprefecture, around the town of Miltou.

languages.name: Migaama

languages.name: Naba
languages.area: Batha region, Batha Est Department, Ati Subprefecture; Batha Ouest Department, Oum Hadjer Subprefecture; Hadjer Lamis region, Dababa Department, Bokoro Subprefecture. Bilala around Lake Fitri and toward the east to Ati; Kuka between Moïto and Bokoro in Bokoro Subprefecture, and between Ati and Oum Hadjer; Medogo southwest of Ati.

languages.name: Mogum
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Bitkine and Mongo subprefectures and Barh Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, south of the Bidiyo.

languages.name: Mukulu
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Bitkine Subprefecture, at the foot of Guéra Massif: Moukoulou, Séguine, Doli, Morgué, Djarkatché (Mezimi), and Gougué villages.

languages.name: Marba
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Ouest Department, north of Kélo.

languages.name: Mpade
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, south of Lake Chad, Makari area. Also in Chad, Nigeria.

languages.name: Mbara (Chad)
languages.area: Chari-Baguirmi region, Baguirmi Department, Massenya Subprefecture, and Mayo-Kebbi Est region, Mayo-Boneye Department, Bongor Subprefecture and Mayo Lemie Department, along Chari River, around Guélengdeng.

languages.name: Musey

languages.name: Maslam
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, Makari Subdivision, northwest of Kousseri, Maltam and Saho. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mundang
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Lac Léré and Mayo-Dallah departments (Léré, Pala), Mayo Kebbi Est region, Mont d’Illi Department (Fianga). Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Mubi
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Mangalmé Subprefecture, east of Mongo, centered in Mangalmé area. 135 villages. Possibly in Sudan.

languages.name: Musgu
languages.area: Far North Province, Mayo-Danay Division, Maga Subdivision. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mabire
languages.area: Guéra Province, Bidiyo canton, Mongo-Rural Subprefecture, village of Oulek.

languages.name: Mulgi
languages.area: Southwest, Tandjile Prefecture, Lai Subprefecture, between the Ndam and the Kimré language areas.

languages.name: Marfa
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Ouara Department, south of Abéché.

languages.name: Sar
languages.area: Moyen-Chari and Mandoul regions, Sarh, Koumra, Balimba, Bessada, Bédaya, Djoli, Matékaga, and Koumogo cantons.

languages.name: Malgbe
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, Chari River area, Goulfey and Goulfey Subdivision, north of Kousseri. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Mbay
languages.area: Mandoul region, Barh Sara Department; around Moïssala. The traditional area is on the border of Chad and Central African Republic. Also in Central African Republic, Nigeria.

languages.name: Ndam
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Est Department, Laï Subprefecture, northeast of Laï, and southeast of Bousso d’Béré.

languages.name: Lutos
languages.area: Ndélé, Kaga Andoro, and Kabo subprefectures. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Niellim
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Barh Kôh Department, Niellim town area, southwest bank of Chari River; Niou in Niou on the northeast bank.

languages.name: Ngam
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Grande Sido Department (Maro), Mandoul region, Barh Sara Department, Dembo Subprefecture, centered in Maro; Ngam Tel in Maro Canton and Moussafoyo Subprefecture; Barh Kôh Department; Ngam Tira at Maro, Moyo, and Danamadji; Kon Ngam in Djéké Canton; Kle at Nara in Djéké Canton; Ngam Gir Bor in Kabo in Central African Republic. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Nancere
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjile Ouest Department, Béré, Delban, and Kélo subprefectures.

languages.name: Ngete
languages.area: Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah Department, east of Pala, Ngeté village area; near the Pévé [lme], east of Herdé [hed].

languages.name: Noy
languages.area: Moyen-Chari and Mandoul regions, between Sarh, Djoli, Bédaya, Koumra, and Koumogo villages.

languages.name: Nzakambay
languages.area: Logone Oriental region, Monts de Lam Department, Baïbokoum Subprefecture, Cameroon border, near Baïbokoum; Zoli in Monts de Lam area. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Sudanese Creole Arabic
languages.area: South, widespread in Equatoria region, into Bahr al Ghazal and Upper Nile regions. Refugees have gone to other countries.

languages.name: Pana (Central African Republic)
languages.area: Bocaranga Subprefecture. Also in Cameroon, Chad, Nigeria.

languages.name: Runga
languages.area: Southeast Salamat region, Am Timan and Haraze-Mangueigne subprefectures; Ouaddaï Prefecture, Goz-Beïda Subprefecture, along Central African Republic border. Also in Central African Republic.

languages.name: Saba
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, northeast of Melfi.

languages.name: Sango
languages.area: Widespread. Also in Chad, Congo, Democratic Republic of the Congo.

languages.name: Ngambay
languages.area: Logone Occidental region; Logone Oriental region, Lanya Department (Bébedjia), La Nya Pendé Department, Goré Subprefecture; Mayo-Kebbi Ouest region, Mayo-Dallah Department. Centered in Moundou area. Also in Cameroon, Nigeria.

languages.name: Surbakhal
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Assoungha Department, Adré Subprefecture, between Hadjer Hadid and Alacha.

languages.name: Chadian Arabic
languages.area: Salamat, Ouaddaï, Wadi Fira regions, Batha region center and west, much of Chari-Baguirmi; Mayo-Kebbi; north Tandjilé; Guéra. Also in Cameroon, Central African Republic, Niger, Nigeria.

languages.name: Assangori
languages.area: Ouaddaï region, Assoungha Department, northwest of Adré and of the Masalit [mls].

languages.name: Sokoro
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, north and northwest of Melfi, Gogmi to Badanga.

languages.name: Somrai

languages.name: Sarua

languages.name: Sinyar

languages.name: Tamki
languages.area: Guéra region, Bahr Signaka Department, Melfi Subprefecture, about 60 kms. northeast of Melfi. Tamki village.

languages.name: Tama (Chad)

languages.name: Tumak

languages.name: Tobanga

languages.name: Toram

languages.name: Tunia
languages.area: Moyen-Chari region, Barh Kôh Department, in Sarh and 3 small villages north.

languages.name: Tupuri

languages.name: Tedaga

languages.name: Ubi
languages.area: Guéra region, Guéra Department, Mongo Subprefecture, southwest of Tounkoul, Oubi village area.

languages.name: Kujarge
languages.area: Dar Fongoro, 7 villages near Jebel Mirra, and scattered among Fur and Sinyar in Sudanese villages along the lower Wadis Salih and Azum rivers.

languages.name: Majera
languages.area: Far North Province, Logone-and-Chari Division, extreme south Logone-Birni Subdivision, Majera area. Also in Chad.

languages.name: Kuo
languages.area: Logone Oriental region, Monts de Lam Department, Baibokoum Subprefecture, near Baibokoum, Pao, and Bouroum cantons. Villages are on roads: north-south road from Pao to Laramanay, northwest from Pao, and northwest from Laramanay to Bouroum. Also in Cameroon.

languages.name: Zaghawa
languages.area: North, northwest Dar Fur, and scattered south; Kordofan. Also in Chad, Libya.

languages.name: Mesme
languages.area: Tandjilé region, Tandjilé Ouest Department, south and west of Kélo, between Kélo and Pala.

languages.name: Zan Gula
languages.area: Melfi Prefecture, Chinguil Subprefecture, northwest of Lake Iro.

languages.name: Zerenkel
languages.area: Guéra Department, Mongo Subprefecture, Canton Dadjo I, Dambiro, Sirbodom, Nikel villages.
